property_description:
Situated within the Derbyshire Dales, Ashbourne Airfield is a unique new development, combining the character of a former RAF Airfield with modern, energy-efficient homes, it’s a place full of charm and convenience.

Throughout the development, you will enjoy green open spaces, including the original runway, now a landscaped area for relaxing and connecting with neighbours. 

All of our homes at Ashbourne Airfield meet the latest building regulations, which sets the standards for energy performance and carbon emissions.

.

A fantastic location

This beautiful development is situated a 5-minute drive away from Ashbourne, where you'll find a range of independent shops, a Sainsbury's supermarket, a Leisure Centre, and Ashbourne Park. The Peak District is also located within 4.3 miles, perfect if you enjoy the outdoors. 

Derby, Burton-upon-Trent, and Stoke-on-Trent are within easy reach via the A52 by car. There are also local buses near by which connect you to Matlock, Nottingham and Burton. Your nearest railway is just 12-13 miles away in Uttoxeter or Derby.

Local schools consist of OFSTED rated 'Good' schools within catchment area, including Queen Elizabeth's Grammar School (QEGS) and St Oswald's CofE Academy. 

This development is also just a 5-minute drive from essential services, including St Oswald's Community Hospital, Ashbourne Fire Station, and dental practices. 

Essentials on your doorstep

Those at Ashbourne Airfield can enjoy: 

- OFSTED rated 'Good' Schools
- Sainsbury's Local Supermarket
- Essential services close by
- Leisure centre 
- Ashbourne park
- Transport links

More than a house builder

Building homes is only the beginning of our commitment to providing places our customers love to live.

We're introducing electric charging points, Solar Panels and more, to all of our homes, future-proofing your home for years to come.

property_description:
Surrounded by 14 acres of public open space with access to the Trans Pennine Trail is a range of 3 & 4 bedroom homes at The Spires. 

You’ll benefit from great access to key locations; M1 is a 5-minute drive, Chesterfield under 5 miles, and Sheffield 13 miles away. Poolsbrook Country Park is nearby, and a play area and community orchard located on the development.

All our homes currently available will meet the latest building regulations, which sets the standards for energy performance and carbon emissions. 

Essentials on your doorstep

The Spires is ideally placed for residents to commute to Chesterfield, Worksop and Sheffield.

Located close to great amenities including shops, pubs and restaurants. There’s plenty to do as a family with days out nearby such as Bolsover Castle or Matlock Farm Park.

OFSTED-rated ‘Good’ schools nearby including Inkersall Spencer Academy, Staveley Junior School, Outwood Academy and Whittington Green.

Efficiently designed homes

You could save up to £979 a year on your bills with a new energy-efficient home.

Selected homes at The Spires feature brand new technologies, meaning your new home is up to 65% more energy-efficient than a second hand home.

Offering an A/B EPC rating, your new home could also include improved ventilation, Solar Panels, highly efficient insulation and more!
Click here to find out more. 

Sustainable living

We're focused on creating a sustainable home for everyone, whether they're human or wildlife.

We're creating over 14 acres of open space and hedgehog highways for our prickly friends.

There will be over 500 new trees planted, plus bee-friendly planting and over 50 bat and bird boxes placed around the development.

property_description:
Your brand-new, energy-efficient home in Sutton-in-Ashfield is set in 3.6 acres of green open space and benefits from excellent road and public transport links meaning you’ll always be well connected.

With easy access to everyday amenities, scenic walks and family days out just a short drive away why live anywhere else? 

NHS employee? Kings Mill Hospital is just a 5 minute walk from your new home at The Hawthorns. 

All of our homes at The Hawthorns meet the latest building regulations, which sets the standards for energy performance and carbon emissions. .

Essentials on your doorstep

Living at The Hawthorns you are just a few miles from Mansfield town centre and can commute with Easy to Chesterfield, Nottingham and Sheffield. 
 
• Supermarkets: Aldi, Morrisons, Tesco & Sainsburys within a 15 minute drive
• Doctors, Dental practices and opticians are a short drive away
• St Andrews Primary School just 1.2 miles away
• Sutton Academy 2.1 miles away, Queen Elizbeth Academy 2.2 miles away
• Mansfield Leisure Park home to different eateries and Odeon cinema
• In need of Retail Therapy? Head to East Midlands Designer Outlet
• Take Scenic walks around Kings Mill Reservoir

Efficiently designed homes

Homes at The Hawthorns feature brand new technologies, meaning your new home is more energy-efficient than a second hand home^.

Offering an A/B EPC rating, your new home could also include improved ventilation, Solar Panels, highly efficient insulation and more!Click hereto find out more. 

Sustainable living

We're focused on creating a sustainable home for everyone, whether they're human or wildlife. We're creating 6.25 acres of open space with over 1300 new hedgerows and over 300 new trees planted. Each home will feature hedgehog highways, with bee-friendly planting and bat and bird boxes placed on key areas around the development.

property_description:
Offering semi-rural living and urban convenience is your new home at Stonebridge Fields.

This flourishing community boasts a prime location bordered by the River Meden and rolling Nottinghamshire countryside. Your new home is within walking distance of local amenities and in the catchment for OFSTED rated ‘Good’ schools. Rail and road links via A60, A614 and M1 will make commuting a breeze.

All of our homes at Stonebridge Fields meet the latest building regulations, which sets the standards for energy performance and carbon emissions. .

Essentials on your doorstep

Your new home at Stonebridge Fields benefits from an excellent location:

Within 20 minutes of your new home:

● Co-op
● Rowlands Pharmacy
● Meden Medical Services
● Sainsburys and Tesco
● Local shops, bars and restaurants
● Hetts Lane Infant and Nursery School
● Birkland Primary School
● Meden School
● Mansfield train station
● Mansfield Woodhouse train station

 

Efficiently designed homes

Homes at Stonebridge Fields feature brand new technologies, meaning your new home is more energy-efficient than a second hand home^.

Offering an A/B EPC rating, your new home could also include improved ventilation, Solar Panels, highly efficient insulation and more!
^Click here to find out more. 
 

Sustainable living

We're focused on creating a sustainable home for everyone, whether they're human or wildlife.

We're creating 6.35 acres of open space, nearly 2 acres of biodiversity area, and hedgehog highways for our prickly friends.

There will be over 1,000 new trees planted, plus bee-friendly flowers and over 30 bat and bird boxes placed around the development.

property_description:
In this beautiful location on the southern edge of Uttoxeter, Poppy Fields brings 2, 3 & 4 bedroom homes. Take a stroll into the town centre with ease and find a number of essential amenities - both local, independent shops and various cafes to grab a coffee & cake. Perfectly situated for commuters, you can easily access the A50 and A518 for travel around the Midlands, with direct links to Stafford, Stoke and Derby.

A fantastic location

Take a walk from Poppy Fields into the historic market town ofUttoxeter, where you'll find the weekly farmer’s market with lots of great fresh local produce, or treat yourself to a lovely afternoon tea treat at the Vintage Tea Emporium.

 

Elizabethan and Tudor buildings showcase the town’s charisma, whilst the nearby Hazelwalls Community Park and picturesque Peak District offer welcome retreats.

 

With the A50 and A518 in close proximity, Poppy Fields offers the gateway to the Midlands, bringing the likes ofStafford,StokeandDerbycloser to home.

Essentials on your doorstep

With the best of both worlds available at Poppy Fields, there are plenty of opportunities for commuters and those looking to make the most of a town full of character.
  • Waitrose, Asda and Tesco all within a two-mile radius
  • Picknalls First School and St Joseph's Catholic Primary School are both within a mile and rated ‘Good’ by Ofsted, providing comfort for parents.
  • Balance Street GP Surgery and Northgate Surgery
  • Health and fitness facilities such as the advanced Uttoxeter Leisure Centre
  • Uttoxeter Golf Club
  • Family outings at Cinebowl, Uttoxeter Racecourse and Alton Towers

 

Energy-efficient by design

It’s comforting to know that, thanks to advanced systems and smart technologies, every brand-new Barratt home at Poppy Fields is built to be energy efficient. According to the HBF data a brand-new home could be cheaper to run than an older home, meaning you could reduce your running costs^

 

Whatever your lifestyle, you'll feel home at Poppy Fields with bright, open layouts and innovative design.

 

For more information on our energy efficient homes, click here.

property_description:
Affinity is a collection of 2, 3 and 4 bedroom homes located in the sought-after, brand-new community of Waverley.

This stunning development offers a semi-rural location with countryside walks on your doorstep, excellent commuting links via the M1 and a range of fantastic local amenities - including Rother Valley Country Park.

Shared ownership homes available with Home Reach.

A fantastic location

This stunning new development is part of an exciting new neighbourhood located in Waverley, Rotherham.Waverley will include a health centre, parks, and amenities, creating a vibrant residential and business community. With Morrisons, Asda, and other conveniences right on your doorstep, everything you need is close at hand.  

Affinity is conveniently located with great transport links toSheffield's bustling city centre.In minutes you can access the M1 which easily connects you southbound toNottingham or northbound to York and Leeds.

There's plenty to do as a family with great days out nearby. Why not visit Ulley Country Park or Magna Science Adventure Centre.

Families will be pleased to know there's schools nearby, including:
- Waverley Junior Academy
- Treeton C Of E Primary School

Efficiently designed homes 

Our homes are built to be up to 65% more energy efficient, meaning you could save you up to £979 per year on your energy bills.

Featuring photovoltaic solar panels, electric car chargers and Argon filled double glazing, our homes are designed from the ground up to save you money. 


Whether you’re curling up on the sofa or chilling out in your bedroom, your new home will keep you happy all year round. And your lower heating bills should give you a warm glow too.

Sustainable living

As well as designing homes you’ll love, we want to make sure the open spaces we create are good for nature and for you.

 

We've created hedgehog highways to allow them to move freely between gardens and installed bat and bird boxes to provide homes for swifts, swallows, and sparrows throughout the development.

 

We also plant or retain trees and shrubs, meaning there are even more habitats for wildlife.

property_title: Barratt Homes at Thoresby Vale in Derbyshire
property_description:
Set in the heart of Sherwood Forest and with a 350 acre country park on your doorstep, its time to call Thoresby Vale home. This new community will also feature a brand-new primary school - Thoresby Vale Primary Academy, as well as a community centre for everyone to enjoy.

Just a stones throw away is Edwinstowe village where you will find all of your everyday essentials. You’ll find OFSTED rated 'Good' schools close by and commuting is effortless with easy access to the A614 and A1.

A fantastic location

Step out your front door and enjoy a gentle stroll to Edwinstowe village in just 10 minutes, here you’ll find a number of independent shops, restaurants, cafés, pubs and bars. If you are looking for a little more, Mansfield centre is just a 20 minute drive away.

Not only is the development home to the new 350 acre country park, living at Thoresby Vale you’ll benefit from a brand new primary school - Thoresby Vale Primary Academy, a new local centre which will feature a butchers and coffee shop to name but a few and with family days out, walks and everyday conveniences close by why would you want to live anywhere else?

Essentials on your doorstep

At Thoresby Vale you can enjoy:


  • OFSTED rated ‘Good’ schools
  • 350-acre country park
  • Effortless commuter links to the A60, A1, M1 and A614
  • Post office located on the High Street
  • A doctors and pharmacy in Edwinstowe
  • Co-op Food for your weekly top up shop
  • South Forest Leisure Complex just 5 minutes away

 

Efficiently designed homes

Building homes is only the beginning of our commitment to providing places our customers love to live.

We're introducing electric charging points, Solar Panels and more, to all of our homes, future-proofing your home for years to come. We're also committed to planting bee-friendly flowers, over 300 new trees, 7,100 new hedgerows and have hedgehog highways in every garden.

This new community will also feature a brand-new primary school - Thoresby Vale Primary Academy, as well as a community centre for everyone to enjoy.  Just a stones throw away

property_description:
Midshires Meadow has an energy efficient* range of 4 bed homes, surrounded by views of the High Peak. Only 16 miles from Manchester, 7 miles from Buxton and 9 miles from Macclesfield whilst allowing you to appreciate nature in the Peak District National Park. 5 minutes to Whaley Bridge town centre, with all your local stores including coffee shops and restaurants for a bit of down time. 

A fantastic location

Recognised as the 'Gateway to the Goyt Valley',Whaley Bridgeis beautifully situated atthe head of the Peak Forest Canal.Set around a conservation area and the Grade II* listed Transhipment Warehouse, formerly an important transfer station for limestone shipped across the UK. The town's aquatic heritage is celebrated in June and known as ‘Whaley Water Weekend’.The town hosts a good choice of small, independent shops selling all sorts, from bikes and special gifts to fine wine and locally-produced food. There’s a selection of friendly pubs, restaurants and cafés to be enjoyed and a Farmers' Market is held monthly. Within easy walking distance to Toddbrook Reservoir - a scenic spot for fishing, sailing, canoeing and walking. Only a short drive away to the natural wonders of Goyt Valley, with its reservoirs and wooded hillsides, is the ideal location for longer walks and exploring the great outdoors.

Essentials on your doorstep

At Midshires Meadow, you will have all you need for day to day living nearby. Here is a list of the places we think you will find handy:Taxal and Fernilee C of E Primary School -0.4 milesKettleshulme St James C of E (VA) Primary School -1.5 miles

  • Tesco - 1.2 miles
  • B & M - 1.2 miles
  • Chapel-en-le-Frith High School – 3.6 miles 
  • Market street offering lots of local shops – 3.8 miles
  • Morrisons – 3.8 miles
  • Aldi – 4.9 miles
  • Goyt Valley Medical Practice (doctors and dentist) 1.2 miles
  • Buxton Hospital – 8.3 miles
  • Chapel en le Frith leisure centre – 3.6 miles
  • Whaley bridge train station – 1 mile

 

Efficient Modern Design

Select homes on this development meet the latest building regulations, which sets the standards for energy performance and carbon emissions. Click here to find out more

We believe a warm home is a happy one, whatever the season. So whether it's blowing a gale outside or April showers are speckling the windowpane, you can relax knowing that staying warm isn't costing you the earth. 


At Midshires Meadow we want to match the local area so we will be building homes using stone and modern building techniques to deliver energy efficient homes that reduce running costs and help the environment too. They're more energy efficient than an older home of equal size and this could save you thousands a year on your energy bills.

Click here to find out more

property_description:
Located in a semi-rural location with convenient city connections is a range of 2, 3 & 4 bedroom homes at Thornberry Gardens.

You'll also enjoy the convenience of being near great local amenities including Meadowhall Shopping Centre, Rother Valley Country Park, OFSTED rated ‘Good’ schools and just a 10-minute drive from the M1.

Some homes on this development meet the latest building regulations, which sets the standards for energy performance and carbon emissions. 

Essentials on your doorstep

Ideally placed for residents to commute to Sheffield or Worksopwith the A57, A1 and M1 nearby.

Thornberry Gardens is ideally located just a short walk from Dinnington where you'll find a variety of shops, restaurants and cafes.

There’s plenty of activities for families with great days out nearby including Rother Valley Country Park, The Butterfly House and Gulliver’s Kingdom.

Efficiently designed homes

You could save up to £1,980 a year on your bills with a new energy-efficient home.

Selected homes at Thornberry Gardens feature brand new technologies, meaning your new home is up to 65% more energy-efficient than a second hand home.

Offering an A/B EPC rating, your new home could also include improved ventilation, Solar Panels, highly efficient insulation and more!
Click here to find out more

 

Sustainable living

We're focused on creating a sustainable home for everyone, whether they're human or wildlife.

We're creating over 1.9 acres of open space and hedgehog highways for our prickly friends.

There will be over 150 new trees planted, plus bee-friendly planting and over 90 bat and bird boxes placed around the development.
